metadata.Title: CVE-2013-3226 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The sco_sock_recvmsg function in net/bluetooth/sco.c in the Linux kernel before 3.9-rc7 does not initialize a certain length variable, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory via a crafted recvmsg or recvfrom system call. An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's bluetooth SCO sockets implementation. A local user could exploit this flaw to examine potentially sensitive information from the kernel's stack memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
